statements: SELECT * FROM access_controls WHERE user_id = 1;
SELECT permission, role_id, user_id FROM access_controls WHERE permission = 'write';
SELECT user_id, permission FROM access_controls WHERE role_id = 2;
SELECT role_id FROM access_controls WHERE user_id = 1 AND permission = 'read';
SELECT DISTINCT role_id FROM access_controls;
SELECT * FROM access_controls WHERE role_id = 1 ORDER BY user_id DESC
SELECT user_id, COUNT(*) AS total_permissions FROM access_controls GROUP BY user_id
SELECT DISTINCT role_id FROM access_controls WHERE user_id = 5
SELECT * FROM access_controls WHERE permission LIKE '%read%'
SELECT user_id, COUNT(*) AS total_roles FROM access_controls GROUP BY user_id HAVING COUNT(*) > 1
SELECT * FROM Employees WHERE role = 'Manager';
SELECT name, email FROM Employees ORDER BY name ASC;
SELECT employee_id, name, email, role FROM Employees WHERE employee_id = 1;
SELECT * FROM Employees WHERE email LIKE '%@company.com';
SELECT permission_id, permission_name FROM Permissions;
SELECT * FROM Employees WHERE role = 'Manager';
SELECT name, email FROM Employees ORDER BY name DESC;
SELECT * FROM Permissions WHERE permission_name LIKE '%read%';
SELECT name, role FROM Employees WHERE employee_id IN (1, 3, 5);
SELECT employee_id, name, email, role FROM Employees JOIN Permissions ON Employees.employee_id = Permissions.permission_id;
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT name, role FROM employees ORDER BY name ASC;
SELECT id, name FROM employees WHERE role = 'Manager';
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE id = 1;
SELECT DISTINCT role FROM employees ORDER BY role DESC;
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE role='Manager';
SELECT name, role FROM employees WHERE role='Developer' ORDER BY name DESC;
SELECT name, role FROM employees WHERE id BETWEEN 3 AND 5;
SELECT employees.name AS EmployeeName, roles.role_name AS RoleName FROM employees JOIN roles ON employees.role=roles.role_name;
SELECT * FROM permissions WHERE permission_name LIKE '%read%' ORDER BY permission_id ASC;
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT employee_name, department_id FROM employees WHERE role_id = 1;
SELECT department_name, manager_id FROM departments ORDER BY department_id DESC;
SELECT role_name FROM roles WHERE permissions LIKE '%read%';
SELECT employee_name, role_name FROM employees e JOIN roles r ON e.role_id = r.role_id;
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE department_id = 1;
SELECT employee_name, role_name FROM employees JOIN roles ON employees.role_id = roles.role_id;
SELECT department_name, manager_id FROM departments ORDER BY department_name DESC;
SELECT * FROM roles WHERE permissions LIKE '%read%';
SELECT employee_name, department_name FROM employees JOIN departments ON employees.department_id = departments.department_id WHERE employees.employee_id = 3;
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT employee_name, department_id FROM employees ORDER BY department_id DESC;
SELECT department_name FROM departments WHERE manager_id = 3;
SELECT role_name, employee_name FROM roles JOIN employees ON roles.role_id = employees.role_id;

SELECT employee_name, permission_name FROM employees JOIN roles ON employees.role_id = roles.role_id JOIN role_permissions ON roles.role_id = role_permissions.role_id JOIN permissions ON role_permissions.permission_id = permissions.permission_id;
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT employee_id, employee_name, department_id FROM employees WHERE department_id = 1;
SELECT employee_name, department_name, role_name FROM employees e JOIN departments d ON e.department_id = d.department_id JOIN roles r ON e.role_id = r.role_id;

SELECT e.employee_name, d.department_name, r.role_name, p.permission_name FROM employees e JOIN departments d ON e.department_id = d.department_id JOIN roles r ON e.role_id = r.role_id JOIN role_permissions rp ON r.role_id = rp.role_id JOIN permissions p ON rp.permission_id = p.permission_id;
SELECT employee_name, department_name, role_name FROM employees e JOIN departments d ON e.department_id = d.department_id JOIN roles r ON e.role_id = r.role_id WHERE e.employee_id = 1;
